intro: Cyrtandra kormanthike, commonly known as the Kauai cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
